title: Theyyam
hero_image_alt: Theyyam performer in bright red paint and headdress
short_description: A potent ritualistic art form from Kerala where the dancer enters a trance, embodying a deity.
long_description:
Theyyam is not just a dance; it is a ritual worship where the mortal body of the performer is believed to become the vessel of a deity. Originating in North Malabar (Kannur/Kasargod), it predates Hinduism and involves the worship of ancestors, heroes, and nature spirits.

The performance creates a surreal atmosphere with red face painting, massive headdresses (some up to 30 feet tall), and hypnotic drumming. Towards the end, the 'Theyyam' blesses the devotees. It is arguably the most spectacular and intense ritual art form in India.
costume_and_makeup: Predominaelty Red. Coconut fronds, fresh flowers, and metallic ornaments are used. The face painting is extremely intricate.

top_places.title: Kannur District
top_places.summary: The land of Theyyam. Hundreds of Kavu (groves) host performances daily in season.

practical_info.audience_tips: It is a religious ceremony, respect the customs. Flash photography may be restricted at specific moments.

seo_title: Theyyam Dance Guide: Kerala's Dance of Gods
seo_description: Experience Theyyam, the divine ritual dance of North Kerala. Witness the trance, the red makeup, and the massive headdresses.
